cluster_relations.rel_desc: Safe passage into the afterlife is a desired outcome specifically for the deceased individual.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The eternal existence in the realm of the gods is something experienced by the deceased.
cluster_relations.subject_entity_name: eternal existence in the realm of the gods
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: in the realm of the gods

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links an afterlife condition, state, or benefit to the deceased individual who is intended to experience or receive it.
args.justification: In both relations the subject is an afterlife state/benefit (safe passage; eternal existence in the realm of the gods) and the object is the deceased, marked as beneficiary/experiencer. A unified predicate capturing 'afterlife outcome/benefit for the deceased' fits both instances and normalizes minor wording differences in the noisy relation_name field.

Both relations describe how specific afterlife conditions function as benefits or intended experiential states for the deceased individual, forming a coherent class of 'afterlife benefit/experience' relations.

The core semantics involve a participant role (the deceased) as the beneficiary/experiencer of an outcome, which fits a broad group concerned with participant roles and affected parties better than composition, identity, or simple association.
